page.title: 14The Year of the Sheep Farmer
page.content: The year starts in the autumn with the ewe having her feet trimmed to avoid foot rot,the wool around the posterior trimmed,an injection for certain diseases and medicine for worms.During October and November the ewes are put to the ram.Six weeks before lambing, the ewes are given extra food to build up their strength and produce milk for the offspring.The lambs are born in March and April,and lambing lasts about 3 weeks.Usually the ewes do not need any help,but sometimes manual assistance is given.The lambs stay with the ewes for 4 months.During the summer the ewes are shorn and the wool sold.Sheep and lambs are dipped in a chemical to stop bluebottles laying eggs which would hatch into maggots in the sheep's wool.The lambs are sold for meat at 5 months.In autumn the cycle starts again.
